trans-unit.source: Add a user to your Azure RemoteApp collection
trans-unit.target: Add a user to your Azure RemoteApp collection

trans-unit.source: Learn how to add users to your Azure RemoteApp collection
trans-unit.target: Learn how to add users to your Azure RemoteApp collection

trans-unit.source: How to add a user to your Azure RemoteApp collection
trans-unit.target: How to add a user to your Azure RemoteApp collection

trans-unit.source: Before your users can see and use your apps in Azure RemoteApp, you have to grant them access to your collection.
trans-unit.target: Before your users can see and use your apps in Azure RemoteApp, you have to grant them access to your collection.

trans-unit.source: This is the easy part: On the User Access tab, enter the account information for the user, and then click the check mark.
trans-unit.target: This is the easy part: On the User Access tab, enter the account information for the user, and then click the check mark.

trans-unit.source: What account information do you need?
trans-unit.target: What account information do you need?

trans-unit.source: That depends on the type of collection you created (cloud or hybrid) and whether you are using Office 365 ProPlus in that collection.
trans-unit.target: That depends on the type of collection you created (cloud or hybrid) and whether you are using Office 365 ProPlus in that collection.

trans-unit.source: The different collection types (cloud vs. hybrid) support using different user identities for access to applications.
trans-unit.target: The different collection types (cloud vs. hybrid) support using different user identities for access to applications.

trans-unit.source: For a hybrid collection of RemoteApp, you need to set up an Active Directory domain infrastructure on premises and an Azure Active Directory tenant with Directory Integration (and optionally single sign-on).
trans-unit.target: For a hybrid collection of RemoteApp, you need to set up an Active Directory domain infrastructure on premises and an Azure Active Directory tenant with Directory Integration (and optionally single sign-on).

trans-unit.source: Additionally, you need to create some Active Directory objects in the on-premises directory.
trans-unit.target: Additionally, you need to create some Active Directory objects in the on-premises directory.

trans-unit.source: For a cloud collection of RemoteApp, any user that has Azure Active Directory support identities can be granted user access to RemoteApp to include Microsoft Accounts.
trans-unit.target: For a cloud collection of RemoteApp, any user that has Azure Active Directory support identities can be granted user access to RemoteApp to include Microsoft Accounts.

trans-unit.source: Office 365 users are Azure Active Directory users.
trans-unit.target: Office 365 users are Azure Active Directory users.

trans-unit.source: If they have Azure Active Directory hybrid, Directory synchronized accounts, they can be granted user access in a RemoteApp hybrid deployment.
trans-unit.target: If they have Azure Active Directory hybrid, Directory synchronized accounts, they can be granted user access in a RemoteApp hybrid deployment.

trans-unit.source: You can use this table as a quick reference for which identity is supported in your collection and what the Active Directory requirements are.
trans-unit.target: You can use this table as a quick reference for which identity is supported in your collection and what the Active Directory requirements are.

trans-unit.source: Check out <link><linkText>more information</linkText><title></title></link> about configuring Active Directory for RemoteApp.
trans-unit.target: Check out <link><linkText>more information</linkText><title></title></link> about configuring Active Directory for RemoteApp.

trans-unit.source: The Azure Active Directory users must be from the tenant that's associated with your subscription.
trans-unit.target: The Azure Active Directory users must be from the tenant that's associated with your subscription.

trans-unit.source: (You can view and modify your subscription on the Settings tab in the portal.
trans-unit.target: (You can view and modify your subscription on the Settings tab in the portal.

trans-unit.source: See <link><linkText>Change the Azure Active Directory tenant used by RemoteApp</linkText><title></title></link> for more information.)
trans-unit.target: See <link><linkText>Change the Azure Active Directory tenant used by RemoteApp</linkText><title></title></link> for more information.)

trans-unit.source: If you are using the Office 365 ProPlus template image in your collection or if you created a custom image that uses Office 365, you are only allowed to add Azure Active Directory users that have Office 365 subscriptions for the default domain of your subscription.
trans-unit.target: If you are using the Office 365 ProPlus template image in your collection or if you created a custom image that uses Office 365, you are only allowed to add Azure Active Directory users that have Office 365 subscriptions for the default domain of your subscription.

trans-unit.source: See <link><linkText>Using Office 365 with Azure RemoteApp</linkText><title></title></link> for more information.
trans-unit.target: See <link><linkText>Using Office 365 with Azure RemoteApp</linkText><title></title></link> for more information.
